questions.question: I will follow you wherever you ……………………….
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.

questions.question: I knew she ………………………. right.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will usually be in the past tense.

questions.question: We …………………………. them next year.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: Does she know what …………………………..?
questions.description: In indirect questions, the verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: He will lose his job if he ……………………….. another deadline.
How soon ……………………….. you know your holiday dates?
She ………………………….. to come with me.
questions.description: When there is no time reference, the present perfect is usually used to give news.

questions.question: We …………………………… away anything useful.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts, habits etc.

questions.question: I ……………………… swimming yesterday,
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: She ……………………….. a boutique in the town.
They never found out what …………………………. to him.
questions.description: Either simple past or past perfect can be used here.

questions.question: My grandfather is eighty but he still …………………………. good health.
